title: Millions Of Americans Could Be Facing Eviction
description: Back in March, Congress approved nearly $50 billion in aid for people who need rental assistance to avoid eviction. At the same time a federal moratorium on evictions  is expected to be extended till the end of the July.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Millions Of Americans Could Be Facing Eviction
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: An estimated 7 million Americans are still behind on rent. And even just the threat of eviction may make it harder for them to find a place to live.
itunes:subtitle: An estimated 7 million Americans are still behind on rent. And even just the threat of eviction may make it harder for them to find a place to live.
content:encoded: Back in March, Congress approved nearly $50 billion in aid for people who need rental assistance to avoid eviction. At the same time a federal moratorium on evictions  is expected to be extended till the end of the July.
